name: Charles County, MD Online Trivia | States M | 10 Questions

questions.text: The current Charles County was created in which year?
questions.explanation:
1658.

	On April 13, 1658, the governor's council established Charles County, Maryland's fifth county.  It is named in honor of Charles Calvert.

questions.text: The current county seat of Charles County is what city?
questions.explanation:
La Plata.

	La Plata wasn't always the county seat; Port Tobacco was.  When Port Tobacco Creek became unnavigable, that town's usefulness as a port ended.

questions.text: Charles County is bordered by how many other counties?
questions.explanation:
8.

	Three of bordering counties are Maryland counties (Prince George's, Calvert, & St. Mary's); five are Virginia counties (Westmoreland, King George, Stafford, Prince William, and Fairfax).

questions.text: Joel and Benji Madden, musicians who grew up in Waldorf, MD, are members of what band?
questions.explanation:
Good Charlotte.

	The band's name is from the title "Good Charlotte: The Girls of Good Day Orphanage", a book by Carol Beach York.

questions.text: On April 28, 2002, an F4-strength tornado cut a 24-mile path across Charles County and destroyed much of the downtown area of which city?
questions.explanation:
La Plata.

	The tornado damaged the La Plata area the most, killing four people.  A previous F4 tornado 76 years earlier killed 17 people, including 14 people at the town's elementary school.

questions.text: What Charles County resident was visited by presidential assassin John Wilkes Booth, who had his broken leg treated and rested at his home on April 15, 1865?
questions.correct: Dr Samuel Mudd & Dr Mudd & Samuel Mudd & Mudd
questions.explanation:
Dr Samuel Mudd & Dr Mudd & Samuel Mudd & Mudd.

	There's an apocryphal story that the expression "his name is mud" derives from Dr. Samuel Mudd, who unwisely took pity on Abraham Lincoln's assassin, John Wilkes Booth. Mudd treated the broken ankle Booth suffered in his leap to the stage of Ford's Theater; for his trouble, he was sentenced to life in a federal prison. But Mudd isn't being commemorated in "his name is mud." The phrase first appeared in print in 1820, 45 years before Lincoln's assassination.

questions.text: How many other Maryland counties are south of Charles County?
questions.explanation:
5.

	Adjacent St. Mary's County extends to the southeast of Charles County.  Also, on the Delmarva Peninsula, the counties of Dorchester, Worcester, Wicomico, and Somerset extend to latitudes further south that the southern-most point of Charles County, Cobb Island.

questions.text: A native of Charles County was the first man to reach the geographic North Pole.
questions.explanation:
True.

	RADM Robert Peary, Sr. (b. Philadelphia, PA) was initially given the singular honor of being the first man to reach the North Pole.  But it was actually his long-time colleague and navigator, Matthew Henson (b. Nanjemoy, MD), who Peary sent ahead as a scout when they were very close to the pole.  Henson overshot the North Pole, then traced his steps back, where he saw that his scout party's tracks had indeed made it to the pole. Henson, an African-American, was victim of the racism of the early 20th century, and not given credit for being party of the team that had reached the North Pole (much less being the first one actually there).   Finally, in 1944 Congress awarded Henson a silver medal, identical to that which was awarded to Peary years before.  Additionally, Presidents Truman and Eisenhower honored him.

questions.text: How many Eisenhower Interstate System highways (those numbered I-##) serve Charles County?
questions.explanation:
0.

	No Eisenhower Interstate System highways serve Charles County.  The closest access to an Interstate highway is I-95, about 13 miles north of Charles County, which is reached by taking MD Rt. 5 north out of Charles County (into Prince George's County) and past Andrews Air Force Base.

questions.text: Charles County is within 150 miles (driving distance) of how many state capitals?
questions.explanation:
4.

	It's within 150 miles of these four US state capitals: Annapolis, MD (49 miles), Richmond, VA (87 miles), Dover, DE (111 miles), and Harrisburg, PA (143 miles).
